<<>>: PrintWriter.write <<>>: InputStreamReader reader = null; try{ File file = new File("C:\\Users\\ваня\\Desktop\\asksearch\\" + list[i]); reader = new InputStreamReader(new FileInputStream(file), "UTF-8"); BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(reader); String line; PrintWriter wr = response.getWriter(); wr.print(""); wr.print(""); wr.print("HelloWorld"); wr.print(""); wr.print(""); int lineCount = 0; while((line = br.readLine()) != null) { wr.write("
"); wr.write(line); wr.write("
"); if(++lineCount == 2) break; } wr.write("
"); wr.print(""); wr.print(""); wr.close(); } <<>>: The BufferedReader.readLine() method is used to read a line of text. A line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed ('\n'), a carriage return ('\r'), or a carriage return followed immediately by a linefeed. The PrintWriter.write() method is used to write the lines to the response. The loop breaks after reading and writing the first two lines.

prompt:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<>>: $API <<>>: $CODE <<>>: $EXPLANATION. Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java? Please using this api: Arrays.stream. Answer:<<>>: Arrays.stream <<>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}; int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum(); <<>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
